channel.title: Talks By Joseph B. Wirthlin
channel.description: General Conference talks by Joseph B. Wirthlin.

item.title: Anchored in Testimony
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, I am honored, but humbled on this sacred occasion. A week ago Thursday, President Kimball called me on the phone and said, “Would you have time to visit with me, along with your wife?” I thought to myself, “Imagine! D

item.title: The Language of the Spirit
item.description: My brethren and sisters and friends, it is a privilege to be here in this sacred place and to attend this inspiring conference. The Spirit of the Lord is here. I have felt it, and I am confident many of you have felt it, for your sustaining faith and

item.title: “There Am I in the Midst of Them”
item.description: Centuries ago, when Jesus taught his disciples at Capernaum on the shores of the Sea of Galilee, he said, “where two or three are gathered together in my name, there am I in the midst of them.” (.) It is the precious privilege of Latter-day Saints to

item.title: Dikes versus Living Water
item.description: I too feel highly honored to be a member of the First Quorum of the Seventy, and sustain all that has occurred on this sacred occasion.

item.title: Let Your Light So Shine
item.description: Some memories are unforgettable, remaining ever vivid and heartwarming! One such memory was the mission conference we attended last year at Dresden, DDR (or East Germany). A president of the Church had not visited there since 1936—a span of over fort

item.title: Let Every Man Learn His Duty
item.description: In my assignments I have some responsibility for directing the work of the Church in the southeast area of the United States, and this extends to include Jamaica. Sister Wirthlin and I recently had occasion to visit that beautiful tropical island and

item.title: Pondering Strengthens the Spiritual Life
item.description: In a revelation given to President Joseph F. Smith, which has recently been added to the Doctrine and Covenants as section 138, there is an important message for all of us.

item.title: Restoring the Lost Sheep
item.description: My beloved brethren, as a former counselor to Brother Nelson on two occasions, I add my gratitude for the call of Elder Russell M. Nelson, and affirm the nobility of his character and the greatness of his work in the kingdom. Likewise, I attest to th

item.title: Pulling in the Gospel Net
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, in all humility and gratitude I ask for your prayers and your faith in this great and humbling and sacred assignment that has been given me. To our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ, and to President Ezra Taft Benson, our

item.title: Patience, a Key to Happiness
item.description: One of the greatest sentences to fall upon human ears comes from the Book of Mormon: “Adam fell that men might be; and men are, that they might have joy” (). That sentence captures the major possibilities of life. Let me add, we will have genuine joy

item.title: Never Give Up
item.description: I am honored to follow President Ezra Taft Benson. I love him as my friend and leader. He is indeed our prophet, seer, and revelator.

item.title: Without Guile
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, I pray for that same spirit that we’ve enjoyed so much during this most beautiful and inspirational conference.

item.title: The Priesthood of God
item.description: My beloved brethren of the priesthood, I am honored yet humbled by the assignment to speak to you this evening. I am aware of the great priesthood power that you faithful brethren bear and of the untold good you do in furthering the Lord’s work.

item.title: Seeds of Renewal
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, we have been inspired by this outstanding and meaningful message of our prophet, seer, and revelator. In addition, this beautiful singing of our young people has been enjoyed by all of us.

item.title: Running Your Marathon
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, I pray for that same Spirit that we have enjoyed so much during this conference. I should like today to address my remarks to the youth, to those of you who still have before you the greater part of this journey we ca

item.title: Personal Integrity
item.description: In a revelation the Lord said, “Blessed is my servant Hyrum Smith; for I, the Lord, love him because of the integrity of his heart, and because he loveth that which is right.” (.) I personally know of no higher praise that any man could receive.

item.title: The Straight and Narrow Way
item.description: While traveling along a mountainous road one evening through a driving rainstorm punctuated with frequent claps of thunder and flashes of lightning, Sister Wirthlin and I could barely see the road, either in front of us or to the right and the left.

item.title: Peace Within
item.description: In recent months, peace has been a very prominent topic on the minds of people throughout the world. When world peace was threatened, many countries found themselves engaged in war. The news media have shown vivid images of the ravages, suffering, an

item.title: Fruits of the Restored Gospel of Jesus Christ
item.description: My brethren and sisters, I’m sure that all of us have been honored to be in the presence of President Ezra Taft Benson, the President of the Church, our prophet. I’ve loved him and respected him all of my life, as I’m sure you have.

item.title: Seeking the Good
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, it’s a privilege for me to be here on this occasion and to have the opportunity of bearing my testimony as to the truthfulness of the gospel and my deep love of its leaders. I pray for the Spirit of the Lord while I a

item.title: Spiritual Bonfires of Testimony
item.description: Many years ago, large packs of wolves roamed the countryside in Ukraine, making travel in that part of the world very dangerous. These wolf packs were fearless. They were not intimidated by people nor by any of the weapons available at that time. The

item.title: Spiritually Strong Homes and Families
item.description: My dear brothers and sisters, my subject today is building homes and families that are spiritually secure.

item.title: Our Lord and Savior
item.description: I pray for the Spirit of the Lord while I speak to you on this sacred occasion.

item.title: Live in Obedience
item.description: My beloved brethren, I am humbled and honored to speak to the priesthood of the Lord’s church. This priesthood now numbers more than two million throughout the world who have made a covenant with the Lord to be His servants here upon the earth. We do

item.title: Deep Roots
item.description: My dear brothers and sisters, I am grateful for the opportunity to join with you during this general conference in sustaining President Howard W. Hunter as the fourteenth President of the Church in this dispensation. He is a man without guile. I sust

item.title: Living Water to Quench Spiritual Thirst
item.description: Early in his mortal ministry, the Savior and his disciples passed through Samaria while traveling from Judea to Galilee. Weary, hungry, and thirsty from their journey, they stopped at Jacob’s well in the city of Sychar. While the disciples went in se

item.title: Windows of Light and Truth
item.description: My beloved brothers and sisters, as President Hinckley walked into this meeting, he said, “We decided to come back.” I replied, “Thank goodness.” It’s a privilege to speak on this occasion, and I pray for the Spirit of the Lord to be with me. This is

item.title: Faith of Our Fathers
item.description: My beloved brothers and sisters and friends, it’s a great privilege for me to stand at this pulpit and welcome into the ranks of the General Authorities these new brethren. We’ve come together in this historic Tabernacle and across the world “to spea

item.title: Christians in Belief and Action
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, it is a privilege for me to speak to you this afternoon, and I pray for that same Spirit that we’ve enjoyed so much during this conference.

item.title: “True to the Truth”
item.description: [Your] most important stewardship is the glorious responsibility your Father in Heaven has given you to watch over and care for your own soul.

item.title: Valued Companions
item.description: In … Church meetings around the world, we come together seeking companionship—the good company of brothers and sisters in the gospel and the comfort of sweet communion with the Spirit of God.

item.title: The Time to Prepare
item.description: The days of our probation are numbered, but none of us knows the number of those days. Each day of preparation is precious.

item.title: Cultivating Divine Attributes
item.description: We will attain new levels of spirituality and place our lives in closer harmony with Jesus the Christ based on how fully faith, hope, and charity become integral components of our lives.

item.title: Inspired Church Welfare
item.description: The Savior, who set the pattern for us, is pleased with those who “remember in all things the poor and the needy, the sick and the afflicted” [D&C 52:40].

item.title: Growing into the Priesthood
item.description: The Atonement of Jesus Christ has given the Savior the power to help you grow into the young man He knows you can be.

item.title: Finding a Safe Harbor
item.description: In our own storms in life the Savior is our solace and our sanctuary. If we seek peace, we must come unto Him.

item.title: Pure Testimony
item.description: As a special witness of the name of Jesus Christ in all the world, I promise you that if you seek the Lord, you will find Him. Ask, and you shall receive.

item.title: The Law of the Fast
item.description: Fasting, coupled with mighty prayer, is powerful. It can fill our minds with the revelations of the Spirit. It can strengthen us against times of temptation.

item.title: One Step after Another
item.description: We don’t have to be perfect today. We don’t have to be better than someone else. All we have to do is to be the very best we can.

item.title: “Follow Me”
item.description: Those who, in faith, leave their nets and follow the Savior will experience happiness beyond their ability to comprehend.

item.title: Shall He Find Faith on the Earth?
item.description: Only when our faith is aligned with the will of our Heavenly Father will we be empowered to receive the blessings we seek.

item.title: The Unspeakable Gift
item.description: If [we] would open [our] hearts to the refining influence of this unspeakable gift of the Holy Ghost, a glorious new spiritual dimension would come to light.

item.title: Three Choices
item.description: I would like to offer my own self-improvement program. It consists of three steps that have been useful to me.

item.title: Earthly Debts, Heavenly Debts
item.description: We have earthly debts and heavenly debts. Let us be wise in dealing with each of them.

item.title: Press On
item.description: There is one thing the Lord expects of us no matter our difficulties and sorrows: He expects us to press on.

item.title: The Virtue of Kindness
item.description: Kindness is the essence of a celestial life. Kindness is how a Christlike person treats others.

item.title: Journey to Higher Ground
item.description: We are faced with a choice. We can trust in our own strength, or we can journey to higher ground and come unto Christ.

item.title: The Abundant Life
item.description: The abundant life is within our reach if only we will drink deeply of living water, fill our hearts with love, and create of our lives a masterpiece.

item.title: Sunday Will Come
item.description: Because of the life and eternal sacrifice of the Savior of the world, we will be reunited with those we have cherished.

item.title: Life’s Lessons Learned
item.description: I urge you to examine your life. Determine where you are and what you need to do to be the kind of person you want to be.

item.title: The Great Commandment
item.description: When we reach out to assist the least of Heavenly Father’s children, we do it unto Him.

item.title: Concern for the One
item.description: Jesus Christ is our greatest example. He was surrounded by multitudes and spoke to thousands, yet He always had concern for the one.

item.title: Come What May, and Love It
item.description: The way we react to adversity can be a major factor in how happy and successful we can be in life.
